Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

‘Metro-Pak Chee’ offers the distinct, robust coriander profile cherished in Thai cooking: a powerful citrus-cumin note with a bold, almost peppery intensity, and significantly less of the “soapy” aldehyde that some find disagreeable. The plant forms a dense, low rosette of large, serrated leaves, staying productive for months.

2. The Soul of Southeast Asian Cooking

This coriander is the indispensable fresh herb for a vast array of dishes.

  • Curries & Soups: A mandatory garnish for Thai green and red curries, Tom Yum, and Tom Kha Gai soups, where its bright, citrusy flavour cuts through the richness and spice.
  • Salads & Relishes: The key ingredient in salads like Yum Som O (pomelo salad) and fresh relishes, providing a fresh, pungent counterpoint to sweet, sour, and spicy notes.
  • Herb Garnish: Used in vast quantities as a bed for grilled meats and as a final flourish on noodle dishes like Pad Thai, to be mixed in at the table.
3. The Harvest and Yield

The plant is a slow-bolting, multi-branching variety. Harvest the larger outer leaves regularly, allowing the central growing point to continue producing. Supplied as an RFID seed pad, it provides a continuous yield of 25–40g of large, potent leaves per week for an extended season.
